thread.title: Cruise and Resort News: Political History on a River Trip; Rain Forest Discounts
thread.title_full: Cruise and Resort News: Political History on a River Trip; Rain Forest Discounts - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Cruise and Resort News: Political History on a River Trip; Rain Forest Discounts
text:
RESORTS WITH A DISCOVERY NETWORKS TOUCH
Discovery Networks, the media company that runs the Discovery Channel and Animal Planet, has put its imprint on a handful of global resorts with its new Discovery Destinations . Each of the six initial resorts was selected based on opportunities for interactions with nature, science and animals. Domestically, they include Nantahala Outdoor Center in the Great Smoky Mountains in North Carolina, which offers hiking, whitewater rafting and zip-lining; Shaker Village in Kentucky with a bird sanctuary and access to 3,000 rural acres; and the riverfront, 200-acre estate House on Metolius in Oregon, which offers fly-fishing, hiking and biking. Destinations abroad include Andaman Resort in the Zhejiang province of China set on 200 acres of rolling hills and bamboo forests, and the coming Terra Paradise Eco-Adventure Resort, set to open on Costa Rica’s Pacific coast in 2016. Rates for Discovery Destinations start at $150 per night.
